alert.note: Alert for Central St. Louis; Crow Wing; North Cass; North Itasca; North St. Louis; Northern Aitkin; Pine; South Aitkin; South Cass; South Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 22 at 6:25PM CST until December 25 at 8:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph causing blowing and drifting snow. Worst travel conditions on Friday. * WHERE...Portions of east central, north central and northeast Minnesota and northwest Wisconsin. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 8 AM CST Sunday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow loading on trees from the past storm in combination with the high winds may cause tree damage resulting in power outages in cold weather. Periods of whiteout conditions are possible.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
